A side dish at the first Thanksgiving, today it's sold in buckets at the movies
Of Dutch origin, today the Krispy Kreme ones are hot
Whether mince or steak & kidney, these say "I'm British"
It's a cured cooked sausage named for a city on the Main in Germany
This style of southeast Chinese cuisine features bird's nest & shark's fin soups among its dishes
This adjective for a sullen child can also be used to describe full lips
This silvery metal is used as an adjective for an album that has sold a million copies
This 6-letter word means "having no equal" or "one of a kind"; therefore, it is redundant to modify it with very or totally
This adjective in the title of a Bronte novel describes the tumultuous atmosphere of the setting
These 2 comparative forms of "far" are used interchangeably, but one refers to distance, the other to time
Eve's name, given to her because she was the mother of all living, is a play on this language's word for "life"
In Genesis 3:1-5 Eve has a conversation with the creature
After the fall, God's punishment of Eve included the pain of this
Adam & Eve's 3 sons mentioned by name
Eve, & the Adam, ate fruit from the tree called this, which God specifically said not to do
clues.response: the Tree of Knowledge (of Good and Evil)

clues.text: 2 brothers, also psychiatrists, discuss fine wine & opera; hilarity ensues
4 friends do "nothing" for a half an hour, get paid 6 figures per episode for their trouble
Dad has 2 hairs on his head, mom's hair is measured in vertical feet, son's hair is represented by 9 points
Title man leaves gas attendant job in small town; his new boss is Vince Carter (the sergeant, not the hoopster)
Man buys a New England inn, has 3 next door neighbors but only one ever speaks
Duncan, Banquo, Macduff
Bianca, Iago, Desdemona
Cinna, Cassius, Cicero
Goneril, Regan, Cordelia
Mercutio, Benvolio, Tybalt
In hair accessories, then sunglasses: Sam Foster &...
In beauty products : Robert Chesebrough &...
In menswear: The Hart brothers, Joseph Schaffner &...
In British retail: Michael Marks &...
In U.S. retail: Abraham Abraham &...
Technically, a drama only has one of these; another character may be the antagonist or deuteragonist
"Cohort" is properly used in the singular to mean a group; it was originally a unit in this army
This adjective from the Latin for "native" emphasizes that something is native to an area rather than from outside
Musicans cringe when this word meaning "a slow increase in loudness" is used to mean "a climax"
This word meaning "reciprocal" may also mean "shared", as when it precedes "friend" in a Dickens title
Along with lemons, which contain more vitamin C, this citrus fruit was used to prevent scurvy
This state was the first to begin raisin' raisins, in the 19th century
Early New England colonists sang about eating this gourd morning & noon, & not just in October
In Matthew 21 Jesus cursed one of these trees for not being fruitful enough
"Ah, why should life all labor be?" asks Tennyson's "eaters" of this fruit
If an appliance runs at 10 amperes on 115 volts multiply 10 x 115 to get 1,150 of these
To get the number of these, multiply the number of kilometers by 100,000
To calculate a pitcher's ERA, divide earned runs by innings pitched & multiply by this
When cooking, to get the number of these in a given number of cups, multiply by 16
Have plenty of zeroes on hand when using Einstein's equation of energy with mass multiplied by this, squared
Created from the earth, this man's name in Hebrew means "red earth"
It's the numerical name for the principal works of Matthew, Mark, Luke & John
Matthew 10:34 recounts that Jesus, the Prince of Peace, "came not to send peace, but" this instead
St. Paul attended a conference in Jerusalem to decide if this "cutting" practice was required
In II Samuel he laments, "Would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!"
It's the "craving" that shares its name with the monetary unit of Japan
There are 6 bashos or grand tournaments every year in this popular Japanese sport
After you perform this Japanese ritual suicide, a friend or kinsman is supposed to decapitate you
Name shared by Japan's prime minister of 1901 & the judge in the O.J. Simpson trial
This city was known as Kyongsong in 1911 when Japan controlled the Korean Peninsula

rounds.text: "The spirit who bideth by himself / In the land of mist and snow / He loved the bird that loved the man / Who shot him with his bow"
